infotexts.entitydescription.thal_headsetchannel: Channeled Headset. Enter a number to change the channel.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_rainbowsprayer: An modified sprayer engineered for painting with a more vibrant color set. Enter colors in the format Red,Green,Blue,Transparency (ranging from 0 to 255). Requires TruPaint, fabricated from other paints.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_sign: A standard white sign for displaying text. Can be attatched to a wall and written on with a pen. Water resistant, but flammable.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_multitool: A mass produced pocketknife issued to many ships by the coalition but used by everyone. Comes with retractable tools mimicking a screwdriver, wrench, and comes with a foldable blade designed with minor alien combat in mind.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_map: Generic Automap that scans the hull to detect the ship layout as well as any abnormalities in the shell. Useful as a map and easy on the battery.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_mapwater: Specially designed Automap designed to not only scan the hull of the ship and the according breaches, but also the water within the ship. Created for use among Mechanics, but good for anyone looking to patch and drain a ship.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_mapair: Specially designed Automap designed not only to scan the hull of the ship and breaches, but also the oxygen levels within the ship. Created for use among Engineers, but good for anyone looking to detect electrical fires or general oxygen absence.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_mapall: Advanced Automap engineered to scan for the hull, breaches, water, and oxygen levels. Its all-seeing nature consumes battery faster than usual.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_foldingchair: A steel folding chair that can be moved, sat on, or swung wrestling-style.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_foldingtable: A steel folding table that can be picked up and moved. Players can also drop items on it.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_attachablejunctio: A junction box that can be attached and detached from a wall. Useful for electricians managing or building a power grid.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dpbm: A machine that plays and layers instrumental loops. Press a button and wait no more than 9 seconds. Each loop is 9 seconds long.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_shockmodule: Wireable module that can be hooked up to the wall like a button. On activation, will discharge a stunning bolt of electricity.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_pen: A cheap waterproof plastic pen with an eraser on the back to rub off ink. Allows you to write on memos and signs, or stab people. Typically restricted to captains to prevent vandalism.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_memo: A small writeable note. Requires a pen to edit. The contents don't persist between rounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_memoboard: Board used for containing memos. Players can mouse over the notes to see what they say. As of Barotrauma 0.10.5.0+ notes unfortunately do not save their contents between rounds/sub editor.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_breachcharge: Shaped charge that specializes in shredding doors. Attatch it next to a door, set it, and run for cover. Ideal for ruins, wrecks, and weld-ins.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_hackeruplink: A portable menu capable of spawning in items from the r3n3g8 catalogue, provided you have the materials.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_powersink: r3n3g8 engineered attatchable module capable of putting a massive load on a power grid when wired in. Useful for electrical pump and dump attacks that will easily mass-fry junctions and occasionally start fires.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_structnanogrenade: A single-use burst grenade that employs nanobots to quickly repair large segments of hull. Ideal for emergencies where quick hull fixes are needed.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_doorkey: r3n3g8 engineered Near Field Communications tag designed to trick a door into opening without the wait of a crowbar. Only good for two uses, so be mindful of automatically closing doors.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_signaljammer: r3n3g8 engineered shortwave frequency bombarder. Will easily prevent radio communication between crew. The disruption increases with proximity, though, so crew may be able to tell when they're nearby.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_discoball: Can be attached to the wall like a button. Thanks for 10K subs on Thalassophobia!
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_streetsign: An ordinary sign with an improbable capacity for bloodshed.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_wirebind: DIY Handcuffs made from wires. Will break after some time of being worn due to natural wear and tear.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_whoopeecushion: A cushion that makes a loud, unflattering noise when squeezed. Can be used like a bike horn, or dropped on the floor where it can be stepped on.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_confettigrenade: Looks like a frag grenade but releases confetti. Good for fakeouts and general intimidation. Yay!
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_blindfold: When worn, obstructs vision. Ineffective on bots.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_chaoshorn: Creates the sound of an explosion, minus the actual explosion. Limited uses, and may alert security. BANG!
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_muzzle: When worn, prevents any kind of speech.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_bananapeel: Slippery. When dropped or thrown, will slip the first thing that walks on it. Must be thrown again in order for more slipping to occur.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_waterballoon: A balloon that can be filled with water if the user is in water, and thrown. Can be turned into fantastical balloonsculpture by a Clown.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_clownkit: A clockwork fabricator used for creating mischevious prank items. While not exactly productive, the fabricator is generally harmless fun.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_paintballoon: This throwable balloon has been filled with paint. On impact, it will certainly make a mess.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_bloodballoon: This throwable balloon has been filled with blood. On impact, the residual mess will probably look like a crime scene.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_jokerevolver: A revolver that ejects a flag instead of firing bullets. Good for fakeouts and general intimidation.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_bowlingball: Bowl like you would throw a grenade. Great for knocking over pins and people.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_clownpack: Stylish backpack with a funny face on it. Partially absorbs shocks and ballistics from behind, making running a good option.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_candle: Decorative light source that uses up wax as it burns. Light/Snuff it by aiming and pressing left click once. Extinguished by water.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_paintbrush: Aim and use (like you would to attach) to put down a pentagram.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_pentagram: A summoning pentagram for the usage of bringing living entities into the world. Cannot be removed once it is placed. Place certain key items within it and press initiate to begin.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_ouijaboard: Occultism board for establishing communications with spirits via poltergism. Used in rituals.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cultistmask: Mask worn by cultists to show loyalty to the honkmother.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_zombieknife: Ancient Shaman Voodoo knife. Stabbing a dead human body brings it back to “life“, and serves as a blood source for clowns.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cultistcostume: A costume frequently donned by the order. Said to be imbued with the screams of 1000 birthday rituals.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cultistknife: A disturbing dagger with a large gutter to collect blood from the living for sacrifices with altars.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cultistkit: An altar used for summoning items through blood ritual. Place your gutter dagger inside and select an option to summon an item, if you have the required blood.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_carver: A cleaver that will carve carcasses into processable meat when repeatedly hitting a dead body. The meat can be used as biomass for hatching.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_mediumbrain: A fresh, sanguineous average sized brain. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_smallbrain: A fresh, sanguineous tiny brain. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_largebrain: A fresh, sanguineous colossal brain. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_smallbreast: A fresh, sanguineous tiny pectoral muscle. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_mediumbreast: A fresh, sanguineous sizeable pectoral muscle. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_mediumthigh: A fresh, sanguineous sizeable quadricep muscle. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_smallthigh: A fresh, sanguineous tiny quadricep muscle. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_largethigh: A fresh, sanguineous colossal quadricep muscle. Can be eaten, processed, used for science, and much more.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_foodcart: Portable Cooking Station. Can be used to prepare a variety of foods depending on what cookware its user has equipped.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_meatgrinder: A handheld meat grinder that can be used to process more manageable meats into ground meat.
A large pot capable of holding most food items. Capable of boiling whatever it contains, provided a cooking station.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_shroomseed: Odd smelling seed covered in spores, capable of being planted like any other. Will produce enough yeast shroom to make you rich, but may release spores.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_shroomcure: Cures Mushroomization. Has a distinct viscosity not unlike Calyxanide.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_zombieseed: A strange, cold seed. Will grow into a Pupa Stalk, which grows maggot hives that can be ruptured for saline. The maggots revive dead creatures so be careful!
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_rustseed: Foul smelling seed that grows into a rustwilt plant. The plant produces opium, but also unleashes corrosive clouds that may burn through surrounding walls and drain oxygen. Somewhat high maintainence.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_clownseed: Funny smelling seed that grows into a Circusprig plant. The plant grows somewhat unpredictable produce, and has the tendency to leak seltzer water.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_wheatseed: A wheat seed from Earth, genetically modified to grow more quickly in hydroponic conditions. Essential for making flour.
A wheat seed from Earth, genetically modified to grow more quickly in hydroponic conditions. Essential for making flour.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_sugarcane: A slightly sweet tasting plant from earth, genetically modified to grow more quickly in hydroponic conditions. Unlike many plants, sugarcane grows from itself instead of seeds.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_botanistsuit: Lightweight suit designed for use handling volatile flora. Mildly resists burns and lacerations.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_botanistmask: Industrial grade mask with an air filtration system built in, primarily to resist the effects of toxic fumes from plants. Can be loaded with oxygen to behave like a diving mask.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_fumigator: Modified flamer that discharges gasses from whatever gas cylinder is loaded into it.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_assembler: Handheld subatomic fabricator that will convert an input item to an output item provided a schematic. Insert a 'schematic' datachip, then insert the material or item specified by the schematic.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_constructor: Attatchable fabricator with the potential to 3D print extremely complex machinery with quantum manipulation capabilities.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipeconstructor:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Titanium-Aluminum Alloy into a Universal Constructor, a device capable of creating items allowing access to the upper echelons of science.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Titanium-Aluminum Bar
infotexts.entityname.thal_recipeplanter: Schematic: Metal Crate -> Small Planter Box
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipeplanter:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Metal Crate into a Small Planter Box, a device capable of growing seeds placed inside it.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Metal Crate
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipefumigator:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Welding Tool into a Fumigator, a device capable of ejecting pressurized gasses.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Welding Tool
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipebotanistmas:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Diving Mask into an Aerosol Respirator, a device capable of filtering out toxic gasses.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Diving Mask
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipedischarger:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Handheld Sonar into a Discharger, a weak rechargeable pistol.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Handheld Sonar
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipefungicide:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Ramblin Evil Seed into an Aerosol Fungicide Cylinder, a pressurized fumigator cylinder for stopping mushroom outbreaks.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Ramblin Evil Seed
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipegeneticinit:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Antirad into a CRISPR Cas-9 Solution, a microfluid capable of targeting genes for grafting.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Antirad
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_recipegeneticgraf:
Datachip containing Atomic Converter instructions for the conversion of a Syringe Gun into a DNA Grafter, a specialized hypodermic needle that can be loaded with DNA to graft.
Insert into Atomic Converter alongside a: Syringe Gun
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cylinderspore: Pressurized gas cylinder containing particle spores for Ramblin Evil Mushrooms. Avoid dropping.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cylinderlaughing: Pressurized gas cylinder containing Nitrous Oxide, a commonplace gas with analgesic effects stemming from deprivation of oxygen to the brain. Avoid dropping.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cylinderfreeze: Pressurized gas cylinder containing Liquid Nitrogen, a cryogenic liquid with and extremely low boiling point capable of rapidly freezing living tissue.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cylindershroomcur: Pressurezed gas cylinder containing vaporized Anti-Mycelium. Kills Ramblin Mushrooms and disinfect victims of mushroomization.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cylinderteargas: Pressurized gas cylinder containing 2-chlorobenzalmalononitrile modified to serve as an airborne irritant. If the gas makes contact with eyes it will result in temporary irritation and blindness. Useful for self defense.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_hydrophonicsign: A sign that can be dropped on the floor or attatched to a wall in order to indicate an area of botanical hazard ranging from exploding pomegrenades to infectious spores.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_botanistbook: Book detailing the care of various crops and plants capable of being grown by the botanist.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_discourager: Self defense weapon that administers a controlled shock, which disrupts the nervous system. The lack of complete incapacitation makes it an ideal weapon for self defense.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_cultistbook: Book detailing the basics of the cultist role. Hold to read, type in the topmost bar to navigate.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_singularity: Horrific gravitational anamoly that grows the more characters are sucked into it.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_secondchance: A steroidal epinephrine solution rigged to automatically inject when in the hotbar of a critically injured person. Going critical with this in your hotbar revives you temporarily, allowing you to seek medical aide.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_geneticinit: Syringe used for initiating Gene Splicing. Equip it in your hands and select which bodypart you want to fuse DNA with. What happens to a body part depends on the DNA fused; Look at the description. After choosing, inject yourself with a syringe, and then inject yourself with a loaded graft.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_geneticgraft: Syringe which DNA samples can be inserted into. When injected into someone undergoing a CRISPR-Cas9 induced meltdown, this attatches the DNA to the cut sections, resulting in en vivo gene splicing. Gene splicing can be used to cure genetic disorders, and even transform bodyparts. Requires a patient to be injected with a CRISPR-Cas9 solution first.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_disordersave:
Syringe capable of trasnfering genetic disorders or mutations (not actual creature splices). Inject a person who is inflicted with disorders/mutations to store them. Afterwards, any future injections with the same transplanter will grant the injectee whatever disorders are stored. Actual creature limb splices are not stored, only the mutations/disorders. Has limited uses.
Currently Stored Disorders (Blank if None):
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_disdatfart: An icon representing DNA data for a mutation/syndrome stored on a transplanter. Drag it out of your inventory to delete it.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disordercurse: A genetic disorder. Your genetic meddling has distorted your natural humanity so horribly that you are an act against god. Just being alive gradually increases your crew's curse level. Can be cured by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disorderclown: A genetic allele that makes the patient gain resistances to stun while wearing a clown suit. When drunk on top of that, they gain regenerative abilities. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disordercard: A genetic allele. Holding a card belonging to a job in your direct inventory gives you a buff related to that job. Assistant: All skills increase gradually Engineer: Burns heal over time. Mechanic: Speed increased. Clown: Being drunk gradually gives vigor. Medic: Immune to opiate withdrawl. Scientist: Any affliction considered "poison" reduced in strength or slowed. Security: Bleeding Reduced. Captain: Stun timer decreases more quickly.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disordersmart: A genetic allele that boosts all the patient's skills, making grinding to level up skills much more achieveable. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disorderpoiso: A genetic allele. When the patient is at full health, the progression of most poisons and infections are reverted and held in their early stages until the patient's health drops below full, or the ailment is cured. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disorderthres: A genetic allele that increases the effectiveness of the Thresher Torso genetic splice to withstand pressure at 10k meters underwater instead of the normal 5k. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disordercrawl: A genetic allele that allows patients with the Crawler Head Splice to drink blood from corpses until they're sucked dry, and to be resistant to food poisoning. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disordermudra: A genetic allele that allows patients with the Mudraptor Tail Splice to gain temporary pressure resistance in water, allowing for 30 seconds more time before being crushed. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disorderhamme: A genetic allele that allows patients with the Hammerhead Head Splice to gain the ability to shoot laserbeams when attacking. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.thal_disorderbapti: A genetic allele. Your genetic modification has effectively made you a new being; 'born again'. Submerging yourself in the holy water of Europa gradually washes away your crew's curse level. Can be reverted by grafting uncorrupted human DNA.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnascanner: A DNA scanner that collects DNA from the saliva molecules of living beings. Will not work on dead creatures. Attach to a wall and interact with it. Scans whatever is underneath it but breaks over time.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnabox: A handheld cryogenic cooler designed to store and preserve DNA without degradation. In the event of the cooler being lost, DNA can also be preserved by submerging it in water.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnahatcher: Pod used for creating creatures from DNA and biomass. Insert meat until there is enough biomass for your desired creature, then insert its DNA and press engage to start forming and nurturing the embryo.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnahuman:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the standard Homo Sapien. Can be used to develop anti-Humanoid technologies, or in DNA grafts for reverting humans back to normal.
Grafting this DNA will revert all changes to the bodypart(s) currently in meltdown, and will also cure any genetic disorders.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnamudraptor:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the standard Europan Mudraptor. Can be used to develop anti-Mudraptor technologies, or in DNA grafts for gene splicing. DNA Abilities by Grafts: Head (Beak): Slowly break down doors using creature attack. Torso (Shell): Gain bulletproof mudraptor armor on spine. Limbs (Tail): Swim Speed increases massively.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnacrawler:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the standard Europan Crawler. Can be used to develop anti-crawler technologies, or in DNA grafts for gene splicing. DNA Abilities by Grafts: Head (Fangs): Lifesteal bite by pressing creature attack. Torso (Gills): Filter oxygen from water even when there is none in the atmosphere. Limbs (Tail): General movement speed increase.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnathresher:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the standard Europan Tigerthresher and Bonethresher. Can be used to develop anti-thresher technologies, or in DNA grafts for gene splicing. DNA Abilities by Grafts: Head (Bone Jaw): Break down walls using creature attack. Torso (Exoskeleton): Pressure resistance. Limbs (Bioluminesence): Emit light.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnahammer:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the standard Europan Hammerhead. Can be used to develop anti-hammerhead technologies, or in DNA grafts for gene splicing. DNA Abilities by Grafts: Head (Hammer Ridge): Hit creatures for massive damage and knockback. Torso (Birthsac): Damaging explosion on death. Limbs (Mucous Gland): Slow regeneration when in water.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnamaggot:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the standard Hive Maggot. Can be used to develop anti-maggot technologies, or in DNA grafts for gene splicing. DNA Abilities by Grafts: Head (Orfice): Aim at the floor and press creature attack to birth a maggot at the cost of health. Cooldown of 4s. Torso (Pupa Sac): Burst into maggots on death. Limbs (Regeneration): Massively increased healing of bleeding affliction.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnathalamus:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the Europan Thalamus. Can be used to develop anti-thalamus technologies, or in DNA grafts for gene splicing. DNA Abilities by Grafts: Head (Fleshgun): Shoots a grappling rope that can pull in enemies. Torso (Seed pod): Infects sub with ballast flora on death. Limbs (Toxin Organ): Completely resistant to most poisons.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_dnaramblin:
Decays when not stored in water or a cryogenic container. Corrupts when fully broken.
Complete genetic sequence of the Ramblin' Evil Mushroom. Can be used to develop anti-mushroom technologies, or in DNA grafts for gene splicing. DNA Abilities by Grafts: Head (Cap): Aim at the floor and press creature attack to discharge invigorating gasses. Torso (Versicolor): The "Mushroomized" affliction greatly heals you. Limbs (Athlete's Foot): Running speed substantially increased, Swimming speed marginally decreased.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_planter: An advanced planter box, designed for improved scientific measurement and botanical metrics analysis required by a botanist. Makes the difference between a hobbyist gardener and a true scientist.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_geneticsign: A sign that can be dropped on the floor or attatched to a wall in order to indicate an area of genohazard ranging from DNA ionizing radiation to gene manipulation chemicals.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_geneticistsuit: Lightweight suit designed for use in mildly radioactive environments. Mildly resists radiations and chance of genetic damage.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_glowsaber: Extremely powerful energy sword that deals large burn damage and is capable of cutting through walls and doors. Its fuel source are the exotic 'glow crystals' produced with antimatter propagators.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_glowcrystal: A crystalline ammo source for various high-power energy weapons. Somewhat rare; Use wisely.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_frostcrystal: A subzero crystalline ammo source for various high-power energy weapons. Its cold core gives it a blue hue. Somewhat rare; Use wisely.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_synthcrystal: A synthesized crystalline ammo source for various high-power energy weapons. Its artificial nature gives it a red hue. Very rare; Use wisely.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_tripmine: Tripmine that activates when in range of a creature. Triggers better the closer the mine is to the torso.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_bombcollar: Extremely dangerous wearable item. Once worn and armed, attempting to remove the collar without disarming will cause a lethal explosion. Has a random chance to explode when armed. Can be disabled by a DISARM key.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_bombcollartimed: A particularly sadistic variant of the explosive collar where arming it not only prevents removal, but also starts a countdown to the collar's automatic detonation. Has a random chance to explode when armed. Assemble a DISARM tool ASAP!
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_bombvest: Vest armed with multiple high grade explosives that will explode upon death of the user. May cause someone to think twice about killing you.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_nukevest: Vest armed with various radioactive materials that will cause a nuclear explosion on death of the user. The explosion is not so notable for the physical harm it causes so much as the extremely toxic radioactive fallout left behind.
infotexts.entitydescription.grapplingturret: Coalition industrial mining laser intended for destroying rock and harvesting minerals. Notably effective at cutting through walls, but it has been designed to not harm beings.
infotexts.entitydescription.grapplingturretloader: Used for loading oxygen into the cutting laser.
infotexts.entitydescription.grapplingturretbeam: Projectile Shot by Carving Laser. Apparently, you are a really good catch!
infotexts.entitydescription.grapplingturretammobox: Plasma-generation pack composed of a primer and lots of oxygenite. Used for heavy-duty cutting operations such as carving lasers and cutter packs. Very expensive!
infotexts.entitydescription.carvinglaser: Coalition industrial mining laser intended for destroying rock and harvesting minerals. Notably effective at cutting through walls, but it has been designed to not harm beings.
infotexts.entitydescription.carvinglaserloader: Used for loading oxygen into the cutting laser.
infotexts.entitydescription.carvinglaserbeam: Projectile Shot by Carving Laser. Apparently, you are a really good catch!
infotexts.entitydescription.carvinglaserammobox: Plasma-generation pack composed of a primer and lots of oxygenite. Used for heavy-duty cutting operations such as carving lasers and cutter packs. Very expensive!
infotexts.entitydescription.emcannon: Renegade-invented directed-energy weapon capable of directionally firing a pulse that will cause minor burns, but more importantly destroy electrical equipment or entities. The loud dazzling projectile may attract attention of listeners and watchers alike.
Used for loading charges into EM Cannon.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_apc: Device serving as a junction box with a built in circuit breaker that also maintains a charge like a battery. Intended for power control interface for a single room; A "player friendly" relay with minor backup power to keep the lights for a little longer on once external power goes out. Can be manually loaded with batteries to recharge.
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_locator: A radio that detects acoustic trasnmissions through water. Can be used to listen in on communications in nearby areas to give your crew sidequests.
infotexts.transmission.weapons.1: The local AHAM Radio has picked up an unencrypted Coalition-signed transmission from a search drone to a map server. Analytics suggest it is heading towards a wildlife research wreck containing high-grade weaponry. If you so choose to take the weapons for yourself, the Coalition will not know it was you. [The location of the weapons cache has been marked on the sonar.]
infotexts.transmission.weapons.2: The on-ship AHAM Radio has deciphered a distress signal from a nearby cargo ship carrying a significant surplus of weapons. Public shipment records indicate the ship was thought to be lost years ago, and was effectively forgotten. If you choose to salvage the weapons for yourself, nobody will know. [The location of the weapons cache has been marked on the sonar.]
infotexts.transmission.weapons.3: The onboard AHAM Radio has picked up a series of standby transmissions in the nearby area. Status reports reveal that the ship was an independent mercenary attack sub, and all life support systems are dead, citing an attack by monsters. If you can clear the monsters, the guns would be yours. [The location of the weapons cache has been marked on the sonar.]
infotexts.transmission.weapons.4: A local AHAM Radio has picked up on a residual frequency from a nearby datacube containing instructions to a "hidden treasure trove" of weapons. The source is unidentified, and the transmission is unsigned. If you choose to investigate, it may be a trap, so come armed. [The location of the weapons cache has been marked on the sonar.]
infotexts.entitydescription.thal_lootcrateweapons: A forgotten crate of firearms found floating out in the open. Finders, keepers.
infotexts.buttonautolimit: Auto Limit Output on Backup Low
infotexts.entitydescription.radbeam: Beam radiation emitter capable of causing severe burns to living organisms, but completely useless against everything else.
Used for loading fuel rods into Radiation Beam.
infotexts.entitydescription.piano: An expensive Grandwin and Sons Piano. The music is only as good as the pianist. Place away from reactors, vents, sides of the ship, and other noisemakers for best results!
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_intro:
ඞHELP/INTRO
This book serves as an introduction to the genetics system of the Thalassophobia mod. infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_index:
ඞINDEX
Below is a table of contents giving a brief summary of each page:
-SCANNER: How to obtain DNA via Scanner -DNA: Proper DNA Handling, Corruption -SPLICING: How to splice DNA to apply grafts -KNOWN GRAFTS: Database of known grafts -MUTATIONS: Rundown of Disorders/Alleles -TRANSPLANT: Transplanting, Isolating Alleles -CLONING: Biomass, Cloning for Fresh DNA
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_scanner:
ඞSCANNING
Every geneticist starts with a scanner to obtain DNA by scanning creatures. DNA is the backbone of genetics. You can hold right mouse button to aim, and press E or Left-Mouse to attach your scanner to a wall. Attached, you can interact with the scanner to turn it on and off. The emitted beam is hazardous and will have slow but deadly effects on people around it left on for too long. It will also break down quickly while active, so use sparingly. To detach the scanner, use a wrench. You can also wire the scanner in order to operate remotely with signals. To obtain DNA, a *LIVING* creature must stand under the beam of a scanner for ~30 seconds. The progress of the scan can be seen on the scanner in the form of a progress bar that gradually fills during scanning. If a creature exits the beam, the bar will deplete quickly: maintain its position by any means necessary. The Institute recommends that scientists use Paralyzant in order to keep the creature alive but motionless. Robust scientists, however, have been known to use other tricks to avoid wasting Paralyzant. Remember that safety of the crew comes first! Once the bar is full, a fresh fragment of DNA will drop out of the scanner. Put it in your cooler ASAP.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_dna:
ඞDNA HANDLING
DNA is a delicate, valuable resource. It is naturally scarce (unless it comes with your submarine), and is difficult to obtain as it requires scanning. Most importantly, DNA erodes when not submerged in water, or when not in special cold storage containers, like your DNA Cooler. Damage/Erosion is irreversable; The condition of DNA can only ever worsen. Given long enough, all DNA will ineviteably erode completely, no matter how careful you are. But how quickly and cleanly you use it determines its longevity. DNA that has eroded completely will become corrupted. Corrupted DNA behaves erratically, and involuntary usage on subjects is considered unethical malpractice. Despite this, experimenting on willing test subjects is encouraged as many of its side effects are potentially beneficial for human survival on Europa, and may aid your crew.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_splice:
ඞSPLICING
DNA can be spliced with the DNA of you or your crewmembers to gain new abilities. DNA can be grafted to three types of target slots: The "Head", the "Torso", and the "Limbs". Each graft has a different effect dependent on the slot and the DNA used. Each slot can only have one mutation; Splicing to a slot will revert any existing preexisting grafts there. Anything grafted to the head slot is an active ability, meaning you can press "Creature Attack" (middle mouse by default) to use it. CRISPR-Cas9 is an intracellular solution that prepares the subject's DNA for grafts. It is consumed on one use, making it precious, and equivelant to one graft in worth. To use CRISPR, equip it. The Health menu must be closed, or it won't equip. You will see three buttons onscreen. Click one depending on your desired slot. Inject it into whoever you want spliced. They will now enter "meltdown": they are ready for the graft. Next, put your DNA in the DNA Grafter. Be quick in order to minimize DNA corruption. Inject the grafter into the person undergoing meltdown. They should collapse and get up shortly with a new ability. Congrats! When humans with grafts die, their DNA collapses and they melt. Revival, organ harvesting, and other things dependent on corpses won't work.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_grafts:
ඞKNOWN GRAFTS
Below is a list of known grafts discovered by The Institute so far. You can see all 3 slot grafts of a DNA and what they do in the DNA sample's mouseover description. It's up to Europan geneticists to find the rest!
MUDRAPTOR-LIMBS Tail that increases swim speed. CRAWLER-TORSO Gills that provide air in water. MUSHROOM-TORSO Pores that regenerate health in spore clouds. MAGGOT-HEAD Launches user at a structure/entity on use. THRESHER-TORSO Shell immune to pressure up to 4000m. HAMMERHEAD-HEAD Head ridge that sends other creatures flying.
Can YOU research all 21 grafts? Better get scanning!
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_mutation:
ඞMUTATIONS
MUTATIONS are a side effect of genetic malpractice. The Institute strongly discourages use of mutations on the general public, but encourages controlled research on test subjects to study and catalogue mutations. There are 30 mutations in all. When CORRUPT DNA is grafted, a random number of mutations (anywhere from 1-7) may emerge in the patient alongside the usual graft. Mutations consist of two types: DISORDERS and ALLELES. DISORDERS are mostly harmful, while ALLELES are beneficial. Disorders are indicated by a FUSCHIA PINK icon where afflictions are normally shown, and Alleles are indicated by a YELLOW-GREEN. The specific mutations you get from corrupted DNA are essentially luck: Initially, you must "roll" for your desired mutations. All mutations will be reverted if you graft human DNA. This is an effective way of curing all disorders in an emergency, or after accidentally using corrupted DNA.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_transplant:
ඞTRANSPLANTING
To make things less random, an item exists to "hold" some mutations from the draw that you want to keep. The DNA Transplanter is an item that copies, edits, and transfers mutations. Injecting someone with an empty DNA Transplanter will store their mutations if they have any. A sound and a binary effect will happen if the storing is successful, and the stored afflictions will be listed in the mouseover description. After this point, injecting anyone with the same transplanter will give them all of the mutations stored. Depending on the severity of the mutations, the condition of the transplanter will decrease. More dangerous or more beneficial mutations (such as alleles) typically decrease condition faster. When the condition reaches zero, the transplanter and its contents are destroyed. This serves as a way to transfer mutations from one person to another, a limited amount of times. The transfer can also remove certain traits. Equipping the transplanter and pressing "Cull Mutations" allows the contents of the transplanter to be viewed on mouseover, like a diving mask or a toolbelt. From here, you can drag out any mutations that you don't want in the transplanter to isolate them. Pressing "Cull Mutations" reduces the transplanter to one use, but you can plant your culled mutations onto a clean subject, and then use a fresh transplanter to scan from said subject.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidegen_clone:
ඞCLONING
Should your DNA wear down and corrupt, there is a way to retrieve fresh DNA from the corrupted sample. Cloning lets you grow the original creature from the corrupt DNA, allowing you to scan uncorrupted DNA from that creature. To clone, hold your Biomorphic Incubation Pod in your hands, aim with right mouse button, and press E or left mouse to attach it. Dropping it on the ground will not work. When properly attached, the Incubator will show a readout of how many kilograms of "biomass" it contains. Each creature requires a different amount of biomass, with humans for one being 60kg. Biomass (meaning organic material) can be obtained by placing any fleshy organs from creatures inside the incubator. Geneticists spawn with a Meat Cleaver that allows them to carve meat out of corpses to gain biomass. Repeatedly hit corpses until blood gushes everywhere and entrails come out. Once the biomass is obtained, interact with the Incubator. You will see a single item slot, and an initiation button. Place your biomass within the item slot, and it should instantly grind and the counter should go up. Once there is enough, insert the DNA of the desired creature and initiate the cloning. You should then be able to scan the creature to gain uncorrupted DNA.
Congrats on finishing the guide! If you're really a true genetics pro, you can deconstruct this book for a free set of genetics tools.

infotexts.entityname.thal_guidestem_tools:
ඞTOOLS
Below is a list of tools and their uses:
-SCALPEL: A small knife used to make incisions in a patient. Makes an entrypoint in the chest cavity. -SURGICAL SCISSORS: A small pair of scissors used to precisely cut a patient. Makes an entrypoint in the abdomen. -BONESAW: A large saw used to carefully (WE MEAN IT) saw the bones of a patient. Makes an entrypoint in the skull, or cuts bones. -ENUCLEATION SPOON: A forked spoon used to carefully extract objects from the patient. Allows for eye removal, or reinsertion of organs.
DO NOT SCREW UP. WE CANNOT AFFORD ANOTHER LAWSUIT.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidestem_prep:
ඞPREP
Below is a list of steps you should take to prepare for surgery:
-STEP 1: Obtain consent from the patient before you do any procedures. -STEP 1: Ensure plenty of blood packs and bandages are present. -STEP 2: Get the patient drunk. 25% or more is enough to do surgery on either yourself or someone else.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidestem_organs:
ඞORGANS
Below is a list of organs and the detrimental effects incurred by their absence:
-BRAIN¹: A non-vital organ residing within the skull. Despite popular belief, patients can and do live without it, albeit with severely reduced mental faculties. -HEART: An arguably vital organ residing within the left side of the chest. Patients can still live without one, though they have severe difficulty doing so, owing to the periodic blood loss and oxygen loss. -LUNGS: A set of organs residing in the chest cavity of a patient. Patients can live without them, but will constantly struggle to breathe, drowning much quicker than the average crewmember. -KIDNEYS: A set of organs residing in the abdomen of a patient. When absent, stuns last considerably longer. -PANCREAS: An organ residing in the chest cavity of a patient. When absent, nutrition gained from food has a much lessened effect on the patient. -LIVER: An organ residing within the abdomen of a patient. Despite its name, the patient does not need it to live. Without a liver, the patient's blood alcohol level does not reduce on its own. -APPENDIX: An organ residing within the abdomen of a patient. Entirely useless, some doctors opt to remove them from all personnel aboard the submarine and gift them to the chef. -INTESTINES: A long organ residing within the abdomen of a patient. When absent, the nutrition gained from food is reduced significantly. -STOMACH: An organ residing within the abdomen of a patient. When absent, food has no effect on the patient whatsoever. -SPLEEN: An organ residing within the chest cavity of a patient. When absent, the rate in which blood loss recovers is greatly reduced. -EYES: An organ residing within the skull of a patient. When absent, vision is rendered useless. -TONGUE: An organ residing within the mouth of a patient. When absent, speech is rendered impossible. -EARS: An organ residing within the skull. When removed, hearing most sounds becomes impossible.
1: It is considered completely unethical medical malpractice to put someone's brain in someone else's head.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidestem_procedures:
ඞPROCEDURES
Below is a list of procedures required to extract organs:
-BRAIN: Saw, Snip, Saw, Snip, Cut, Snip, Cut, Saw, Cut, Snip. Act fast before the blood loss kills the patient. -HEART: Cut, Saw, Cut, Saw -LUNGS: Snip, Saw, Snip -KIDNEYS: Cut, Cut, Snip -PANCREAS: Cut, Snip, Snip -LIVER: Snip, Snip, Cut -APPENDIX: Snip, Snip, Snip -INTESTINES: Snip, Cut, Cut -STOMACH: Snip, Cut, Snip -SPLEEN: Cut, Snip, Cut -EYES: Cut, Scoop, Snip -TONGUE: Snip, Cut, Scoop -EARS: Snip, Snip, Scoop
To re-insert an organ, perform a procedure to the second-to-last step and use an enucleation spoon to insert the relevant organ.
infotexts.entityname.thal_guidestem_upkeep:
ඞUPKEEP
It is very important to keep your tools clean. Failing to do so can result in septic wounds, which reduce the capacity of the patient to function properly in the crew and reduce their pain tolerance. Below is important information in regards to septic wounds and cleaning tools:
-TOOL CLEANING: Simply submerging tools in Europan water is enough to properly clean them. Unclean tools will appear bloody and, if used too much, will cause wounds to go septic.
-SEPTIC WOUNDS: Doses of broad-spectrum antibiotics, or any other medicine which allows the patient to resist the Europan Velonaceps Calyx parasite, will assist in recovery. Failure to treat septic wounds can result in death if the patient is already injured.
This concludes the S.T.E.M. Surgical Handbook. Put this knowledge to good use and practice medicine. Consider teaming up with a cook.
DO NOT DO ANYTHING THAT WOULD RESULT IN A MALPRACTICE SUIT, THEY ALL FALL BACK ON US.
